p: There was a significant increase in the plasma levels of triglycerides (TG), low-density lipoprotein (LDL), total cholesterol (TC), and very low density lipoprotein (VLDL) with a concomitant decrease in the plasma levels of high-density lipoprotein (HDL) in diabetic mice, whereas these were normalized to the level of control mice in the C. auriculata root extract and metformin-treated mice. In addition, the atherogenic index, a new index to determine the alteration in the lipid profile, was also found to be higher in diabetic mice compared to the mice of other groups studied ( Table 8 ).
